DataElement.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule)._Indicates the accession number for a Gene within the GenBank database.:One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome._The unique identifier provided by GenBank, for a sequence record. [Explanatory comment: An accession number applies to the complete record and is usually a combination of a letter(s) and numbers, such as a single letter followed by five digits (e.g., U12345) or two letters followed by six digits (e.g., AF123456). Some accessions might be longer, depending on the type of sequence record]

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule)._Indicates the accession number for a Gene within the GenBank database.:One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position (locus) on a particular chromosome, is capable of reproducing itself exactly at each cell division, and directs the formation of a protein or other product. The gene as a functional unit consists of a discrete segment of a giant DNA molecule containing the purine (adenine and guanine) and pyrimidine (cytosine and thymine) bases in the ordered and correct sequence that encodes a specific functional product (i.e., a protein or RNA molecule).

Concepts.definition: A functional unit of heredity which occupies a specific position on a particular chromosome and serves as the template for a product that contributes to a phenotype or a biological function.

Property.preferredDefinition: Indicates the accession number for a Gene within the GenBank database.:One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome.

Concepts.definition: Indicates the accession number for a Gene within the GenBank database.

One or more characters and/or numbers that are used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of genomic sequences, mRNA transcripts, protein products, or other class of entities that occurs throughout the genome.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The unique identifier for an entire sequence record when the record is submitted to GenBank. [Explanatory comment: An accession number applies to the complete record and is usually a combination of a letter(s) and numbers, such as a single letter followed by five digits (e.g., U12345) or two letters followed by six digits (e.g., AF123456). Some accessions might be longer, depending on the type of sequence record.]

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.

Concepts.definition: One or more characters used to identify, name, or characterize the nature, properties, or contents of a thing.
